title: Manchester derby could be played in America | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 430 shares The two giants were set to do battle in China last year but heavy rain in Beijing saw it cancelled, with the Bird’s Nest pitch unplayable. Manchester United and Manchester City should announce their tour plans next month, with their derby not yet confirmed. That depends on schedules, with City likely to spend some time in the Midwest - where 109,000 crammed into the Michigan Stadium to watch United take on Real Madrid in 2014. United are thought to be heading for the west coast. Pep Guardiola's team were due to meet United in Beijing in 2016, before it was cancelled City travelled to Abu Dhabi immediately after Tuesday night’s breathless 5-3 Champions League victory over Monaco. Guardiola’s opted to go away for warm-weather training given they have no game this weekend, while Yaya Toure claims City need to score twice in France to progress against the Ligue 1 leaders next month. ‘We need to score two goals and we have to be careful,’ Toure said. ‘The tie is not finished yet, still we have a game to play away at Monaco. ‘We have to not underestimate them, and try to score goals again. We are a team we can score goals or we can concede goals. ‘From the beginning of the season until now, we always attack. We always show that, that's the most important. Jose Mourinho, pictured giving an interview at the Olympic Sports Center in Beijing in July ‘With the new manager now it's all about attack. Sometimes you can do a mistake, but mistakes are part of the game. If you don't do mistakes, the football is not going to follow.’ Toure hopes the dramatic manner of their comeback - scoring three times in 11 second-half minutes - will help galvanise supporters who are disenfranchised with the Champions League. ‘The fans were brilliant - we were talking about it in the dressing room,’ he added. ‘That's the kind of support we want, they were pushing, they were with us. We know that if we perform like that, we are going to have more and more fans again. ‘We just try to do our best, try to come close to United - it's what's got to happen in the few years coming.'
